recommendation_reason: This product is high in calories, fat, and salt, and contains multiple flavor enhancers (MSG, disodium guanylate, disodium inosinate), making it an unhealthy choice for regular consumption despite no specific allergy risks for the user[2][5][6].

nutrition_components.name: Energy
nutrition_components.reason: Very high in calories, which can contribute to weight gain if consumed in excess[2][5].

nutrition_components.name: Fat
nutrition_components.reason: High fat content, especially in a snack food, increases calorie density and may contribute to cardiovascular risk if consumed frequently[2][5].

nutrition_components.name: Saturated Fat
nutrition_components.reason: Moderate saturated fat; below some snack foods, but still should be limited for heart health[2][5].

nutrition_components.name: Carbohydrates
nutrition_components.reason: High in refined carbohydrates, which can spike blood sugar and provide little satiety[2][5].

nutrition_components.name: Sugars
nutrition_components.reason: Sugar content is moderate for a savory snack, but still adds to overall calorie load[2][5].

nutrition_components.name: Fiber
nutrition_components.reason: Low fiber content, which means less satiety and fewer digestive benefits[5].

nutrition_components.name: Proteins
nutrition_components.reason: Protein is present but not significant enough to make this a filling or nutritious snack[5].

nutrition_components.name: Salt
nutrition_components.reason: Very high salt content, exceeding recommended daily intake in a single serving, increasing risk of hypertension[2][5].

nutrition_components.name: Sodium
nutrition_components.reason: High sodium content, which can contribute to high blood pressure and cardiovascular disease[2][5].

key_ingredients.name: Farine de maïs (Corn flour)
key_ingredients.health_impact: Refined corn flour is low in fiber and micronutrients, contributing mainly empty calories[5].

key_ingredients.name: Huile de tournesol (Sunflower oil)
key_ingredients.description: Vegetable oil used for frying and texture.
key_ingredients.health_impact: High in omega-6 fatty acids; excessive intake may promote inflammation if not balanced with omega-3s[5].

key_ingredients.name: Poudre de fromage (Cheese powder)
key_ingredients.health_impact: Adds saturated fat and sodium, increasing cardiovascular risk if consumed in excess[5].

additives.name: Monosodium glutamate (MSG)
additives.description: Flavor enhancer used to intensify savory taste.
additives.potential_effects: Generally recognized as safe, but some individuals may report sensitivity (headaches, flushing); scientific evidence for widespread adverse effects is lacking[6].

additives.name: Disodium guanylate
additives.description: Flavor enhancer often used with MSG.
additives.potential_effects: Safe for most, but should be avoided by people with gout or uric acid issues; enhances umami flavor[7].

additives.name: Disodium inosinate
additives.description: Flavor enhancer, usually combined with MSG.
additives.potential_effects: Safe for most, but may cause issues for those sensitive to purines or with gout[7].

additives.name: Paprika extract (colorant)
additives.potential_effects: Generally recognized as safe; used for color[7].

sources.title: Combien y a-t-il de calories dans 3D's Bugles, Goût Fromage - Fitatu
MSG: What Are Its Potential Side Effects? - EatingWell
What are e-numbers in foods, are they harmful? - Nexus Ingredient
